meanings.definition: A person who hunts foxes for sport.
meanings.sent1: The foxhunter rode on his horse through the woods.
meanings.sent2: The foxhunter set out early in the morning to track down the foxes.
meanings.sent3: The foxhunter accidentally mistook a squirrel for a fox and had quite the adventure.
meanings.sent4: She was a skilled foxhunter, always able to outsmart the clever foxes.
meanings.sent5: The foxhunter's horn echoed through the forest, signaling the start of the hunt.

meanings.definition: A dog trained to hunt foxes.
meanings.sent1: The loyal foxhunter eagerly followed the scent of the fox.
meanings.sent2: The foxhunter barked excitedly as it chased after the elusive fox.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous foxhunter decided to take a nap instead of hunting today.
meanings.sent4: The swift foxhunter darted through the bushes, hot on the trail of the fox.
meanings.sent5: The determined foxhunter never gave up until it caught its prey.

meanings.definition: A horse used for fox hunting.
meanings.sent1: The majestic foxhunter carried its rider gracefully across the fields.
meanings.sent2: The foxhunter neighed softly as it trotted alongside the other horses.
meanings.sent3: The playful foxhunter enjoyed rolling in the mud after a long day of hunting.
meanings.sent4: The experienced foxhunter knew the best paths to take during the hunt.
meanings.sent5: The strong foxhunter leaped over obstacles with ease, keeping up with the pack.
